column15: Mixed materials (e.g., sand, gravel, clay); depends on compaction and composition.
Young soils with variable textures (loamy, silty, or sandy).
Sandy soils allow high permeability; low water retention.
Shallow soils over rock; often gravelly or rocky.
Poorly drained soils with water stagnation; clay layers reduce permeability.
Waterlogging common due to dense subsurface layers.
Wetland soils with high water retention but poor drainage.
Organic soils with high porosity but variable permeability.
Sandy topsoil is permeable, but clay and organic layers may reduce permeability.
